title: Peer B failed to sync from Peer A while Peer A was once interrupted by "exit" command in js console
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.8.12  stable
OS & Version: Windows 10
Go Version: 1.10.3

#### Expected behaviour
Succeed to sync the blocks

#### Actual behaviour
Peer A was interrupted when Peer B was syncing from it.  Then Peer A restarted. Peer B cleaned its blocks data and re-addpeer Peer A, but **Peer B failed to sync**.  
When debuging, Peer A could not find bytes with given stateroot hash in handler.go,  line 549:   `pm.blockchain.TrieNode(hash)`,

code:
```
	case p.version >= eth63 && msg.Code == GetNodeDataMsg:
		// Decode the retrieval message
		msgStream := rlp.NewStream(msg.Payload, uint64(msg.Size))
		if _, err := msgStream.List(); err != nil {
			return err
		}
		// Gather state data until the fetch or network limits is reached
		var (
			hash  common.Hash
			bytes int
			data  [][]byte
		)
		for bytes < softResponseLimit && len(data) < downloader.MaxStateFetch {
			// Retrieve the hash of the next state entry
			if err := msgStream.Decode(&hash); err == rlp.EOL {
				break
			} else if err != nil {
				return errResp(ErrDecode, "msg %v: %v", msg, err)
			}
			// Retrieve the requested state entry, stopping if enough was found
			if entry, err := pm.blockchain.TrieNode(hash); err == nil {
				data = append(data, entry)
				bytes += len(entry)
			}
		}
		return p.SendNodeData(data)

```
And body/receipt canceled:
```
Node data write error
state node 6ab3c0…6ecec8 failed with all peers (1 tries, 1 peers)
err="block body download canceled (requested)"
err="receipt download canceled (requested)"
err="state node 6ab3c0…6ecec8 failed with all peers (1 tries, 1 peers)"
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1. start a private node as Peer A(with custom genesis), mining by cpu with 1000+ blocks(make sure we have enough time to input "exit" in js console when syncing)
2. start a private node as Peer B, add the peer of A,   then  quickly  input "**exit**" and press enter on Peer A **before** syncing finished.
3. start A, clean data of B, then re-syncing with A.
4. check the log of Peer B and found such errors mentioned above. Also, the eth.blockNumber always returns 0.

#### Client Logs
Total blocks: 6275
Full log of Peer B when syncing with A:
